thread.title: The Cool Hotel Guide: Soho Farmhouse, Great Tew, Oxfordshire
thread.title_full: The Cool Hotel Guide: Soho Farmhouse, Great Tew, Oxfordshire

title: The Cool Hotel Guide: Soho Farmhouse, Great Tew, Oxfordshire
text:
The cabins are made from reclaimed Romanian wood 2 of 2 Tom Chesshyre Published 1 minute ago Part of the Soho House chain, this ‘village’, set around small lakes and car-free trails, even has an ice rink in winter 
When Soho House opened in Soho, London, in 1995, those behind the private members’ club could have had little idea that two decades later they would be launching a private members’ village in the Cotswolds. Yet this is more or less what Nick Jones, Soho House founder, and his business partners, have set about achieving in 100 acres of rolling land leased from the Great Tew Estate. It’s a pretty big deal: at last weekend’s launch of this new hotel/country club — open to nonmembers for overnight stays — the guest list included Princess Eugenie, actor Eddie Redmayne, actress Cressida Bonas (Prince Subscribe now
